data.title: Issues with Sublime Text Keymap
data.body:
Testing #14317
## These are invalid:
#### `+` is not a valid key code

Please see https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/customization/keybindings#_accepted-keys for a list of accepted key codes
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/19679754/6abc963a-9aa3-11e6-960a-c181dddde74d.png)
## These are IMHO incorrect:
#### `shift-tab` is not indenting in sublime

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/19679498/47b8f8dc-9aa2-11e6-9591-f8cf202ef185.png)
#### `ctrl+shift+[` is bound to fold in Sublime (not to unfold)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/19679662/e721ca2a-9aa2-11e6-8c93-8d928e3efc72.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/19679670/f01881fa-9aa2-11e6-9631-8aca1acd7c59.png)
## These are missing:
#### all fold level-related commands (`ctrl+k ctrl+number`)

data.title: Terminal scroll commands on OS X should be preceded with Cmd
data.body:
#13440

Terminal scroll commands on OS X should be preceded with <kbd>Cmd</kbd>. <kbd>Home</kbd> and <kbd>End</kbd> should put the cursor at the beginning and end of the input line.

data.title: Debug: setting expression and hit-count at the same time does not hit anything
data.body:
Testing #13211
- I run a simple extension with a command
- I defined 2 conditions for when the command gets executed: expression and hit-count

=> the breakpoint is never being hit

I can provide more steps to reproduce but maybe this scenario is not even supported?

Testing #14305

- OS Version: Mac OS

Steps to Reproduce:

data.title: When I save my js file, vs code format my source code,It is so bad
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T16:21:53.542Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586
- Extensions: lonefy.vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter-0.2.1

Steps to Reproduce:
When I save my js file, "vs code" format my source code,It is so bad.
Like so:
[
    'text'
    , 'radio'
    , 'checkbox' 
].forEach

When I hit ctrl + s,code format like this below:
[
    'text', 'radio', 'checkbox'
].forEach

data.title: Variables view and watch view are not in sync
data.body:
Testing #14305 (Might not be related)
- VSCode Version: Latest Insiders
- OS Version: Mac OS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a snippet that contains an Object. Say:

```
let myObject = {
  a: 1
  b: 2
  c: 3
}
....
```
1. Put a break point after array definition. Start debugging 
2. Watch `myObject` variable
3. After break point is hit, change value of any property of myObject

Expected:
`myObject` values should be same in Variables and Watch view

data.title: Debug: validate user input for breakpoint hit-count
data.body:
Testing #13211

Since you already seem to have a regex to check for validity of the breakpoint hit-count, why not tell the user?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/19679114/ecc589be-9aa0-11e6-938a-42088595feca.png)

data.title: Debug: help the user what to put into breakpoint hit count expression

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #13211

I find the test plan description helpful to understand what kind of hit-count expressions you can put in, especially the %2 for breaking on every other hit. I suggest to also mention this in the ghost text of the input field to help the user.

data.title: Variable not updating in variables view after setValue
data.body:
Testing #14305 (Might not be related)
- VSCode Version: Latest Insiders
- OS Version: Mac OS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a snippet that contains an Array. Say:

```
let myArray = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
....
```
1. Put a break point after array definition. Start debugging 
2. After break point is hit, change the length of myArray to say `0`

Expected:
Array values should be updated

Actual:
Array values remain as before.
Confirmed in the debug console that array values are modified

data.title: Debug: inform user how to enable expression/hit-count breakpoint
data.body:
Testing #13211

It seems only by pressing enter can you confirm a change to expression or hit-count, I suggest to show this in the ghost-text of the input field. Also mention ESC to cancel and close the box.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/19679027/847e6a7e-9aa0-11e6-8e13-367431d0c066.png)

data.title: Output: shows ugly highlight on empty line now
data.body:
See:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/19678940/2560c8ac-9aa0-11e6-8f92-9e9beed10598.png)

data.title: Debug: hover on breakpoint should show expression and hit count
data.body:
Testing #13211

If you define both hit count and expression for a breakpoint, both should show up in the hover with some info which is which.

data.title: Debug: show expression or hit count based on relevancy
data.body:
Testing #13211

It seems you always show "Expression" when you right click a debug breakpoint and say "Edit Breakpoint". I suggest to
- always show the one that has something defined (e.g. hit count when there is only hit count)
- show the one that was previously used otherwise

data.title: cannot remove breakpoint
data.body:
testing #13940
- toggle setting to enable breakpoint everywhere
- set a breakpoint in a random file
- toggle back the setting
- 🐛 you cannot remove the breakpoint anymore. Removing breakpoint should always be allowed IMO, just adding should be controlled by the aforementioned flag.

data.title: Bad wording for setting
data.body:
testing #13940 

Configure the `"debug.allowBreakpointsEverywhere"` and notice the wording you get in IntelliSense/Hover. It reads _Allows setting breakpoints for all files, no matter the extension._ which is hard to understand. How about _Allows setting breakpoint in any file_?

data.title: Debug stop icon changes to attach when pressing play
data.body:
Testing #13211
- debug an extension
- hit a breakpoint
- press play
- stop icon changes to attach icon

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/19678671/0020009a-9a9f-11e6-99b5-48c0afe92c09.png)

data.title: very ugly search syntax
data.body:
testing #14348 
- Select the language picker and search for extensions
- The extensions viewlet is populated with `tag:__ext_html`

That's a very ugly syntax, which looks a lot like some internal search query and not like a query language users are supposed to remember/write. I'd suggest to either improve the syntax or not expose it to the user at all

data.title: Cannot change python image file name to save.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install the package - "Python" by Don Jayamanne
2. Write simple python script to plot a graph.
3. `cmd + shift + p`  
4. select "Python: Run python file in terminal"
5. Once the graph shows up click save button on the plot window.
6. Try changing the name of the file being saved.
7. **You will not be able to change the file name**.

data.title: Stack frame title should be rendered using a mono space font
data.body:
Render stack frames using a mono space font to improve visibility.
It will also allign nicer with the breakpoint view.

data.title: Breakpoints should render snippet of code line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Similar to how we show snippets in find references we should also show references in breakpoints pane. code snippet         filename : line number alligned to the right
Code snippet should be shown using a mono space font

data.title: Open in background hotkey should only activate if cursor is at end of line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7

The right arrow key used to open the selected quick open item in the background should only dispatch if the cursor was at the end of the line and not used with another modifier e.g. option or command/ctrl.

When navigating up/down through the list, the cursor should be placed to the end of the line.  This behavior is similar to ST.

/cc @bpasero 

Feel free to assign to me and comment regarding your feelings on the UX.

data.title: Test: Extensions recommendations per language mode
data.body:
#13415
- [x] any OS @kieferrm 
- [x] any OS @jrieken 

![img](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/19602049/f8354836-97ab-11e6-8b17-f36ff0f29a97.png)

There is now a new item in the language mode picker which lets the user search for extensions in the Marketplace that can handle or are related to that extension.

data.title: Notify users of extensions when opening unknown file type

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
cc @seanmcbreen @waderyan 

> The scenario here is that the user adds a new file say foo.tex we don;t out of the box know what .tex is so we render as plaintext. We could do a check in the background to see if the marketplace understands .tex since it does we would notify the user and let them review the marketplace for results.
> 
> There is some concern that this could be annoying for some users who look at lots of files with random extensions - so we need to go here carefully. We would for instance need to offer the ability to stop the nag permanently for some file types.

data.title: Python fold also collapses vertical white space
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a python script with functions/classes/code block (thing that you can fold)
2. Add some new lines after the code block 
3. Press the [-] on the left to fold the code block
4. Observe as the new lines (that don't belong to the code block) also collapse into the block
5. This means you can't have vertical space between collapsed blocks!

This is really annoying when working with python. This behavior is not present in Visual Studio nor in Atom so I'm sure it is not expected behavior.

data.title: Errors stay in files even after you delete them
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.61
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a project with a file that has errors in it (in my case, an F# Ionide project)
2. See that the lower left error count is up
3. Delete the file that has the errors
4. Observe the lower left error count persist (even though the file is gone)

Ps. you can access it by also pressing Ctrl+Shift+M

data.title: intellisense in debug console adds extra character
data.body:
- VSCode Version: insiders 1.7 c038219f8d137b4972a15346b81ea03751d669d4
- OS Version: Mac

Steps to Reproduce:
1. new node/express app
2. npm install
3. set up debugging
4. hit breakpoint
5. in debug console, type in name of a variable and get intellisense to complete
6. accept completion by hitting enter

result: extra dupe character at beginning of line

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/19673083/72f31328-9a31-11e6-81dd-6291b23391e3.png)

now press enter, note extra 'r' at beginning.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/19673091/7e48fd6e-9a31-11e6-80bb-ceb125087ab1.png)

data.title: Keybinding for recently opened projects / folders functionality
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.6.1 (1.6.1)
- OS Version: Mac OS Sierra

Currently, apparently the user must mouse over to the VS Code "File" menu and click before keys can be used to select the recent Folder to open. 

It would be good to at least have a  way to open the "File" top menu with a keybinding.  Or alternatively, some keybinding to browse recent projects.
